l
[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a freshly expanded hole, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a newly excavated opening, a hardened leather barbuta, a large glossy black coral charm, a dark oiled leather breastplate, a battle scarred ebony parrying shield, an open striped leopardskin bag, and some short iron ice tongs are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st thick maned black stallion (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st wolf (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st young green wyvern, and the 1st green wyvern.
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Aliyah the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Layana the Secian (flying beside you), Stanrar the Noble Human, Kristiona the Noble Leuian, Darrow the Secian, Osire the Noble Hithual, Aeslyn the Noble Drake, Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Romilin the Noble Psycian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Mirrdae the Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Roknar the Noble Human, Chip the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Erich the Leuian, Smite the Oog-ra (holding a flaming glittering multicolored glass orb), Pollii the Secian (holding a glowing pure white crystal long-stemmed rose), Vincel the Psycian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Draffut the Drake, Batch the Noble Hithual, Vermithrax the Drake (flying 10 feet above you), Viator the Draco, Tau the Leuian (a black kitten upon his left shoulder), Meliya the Noble Secian, Marinda the Secian, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Ying the Drake, Dror the Noble Thugian, Relawen the Drake, Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet above you), Kiralyn the Secian (flying 10 feet above you), Syai the Noble Drake (flying 10 feet above you), and Tygrus the Leuian.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest.

[Open plains]

Immense fir, redwood and sequoia trees block your path to the north up into the foothills. The ground here is full of rusty metal and small mounds, making the footing somewhat unstable.  The smell of an alpine forest drifts from the treeline.  A wooden tree branch, a glowing holy mark of Odarous, a worn leather money belt, a tattered weathered newspaper, a pair of ivy embossed leather gloves, some copper studded leather gauntlets, an ugly green troll mask, a gnarled weathered oak branch, a tiny shrunken skull pendant, an ancient jade eyed jackal sigil, and a pair of soft brown doeskin gloves are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st young green wyvern, the 2nd young green wyvern, the 1st white tailed doe, the 1st raccoon, the 1st green wyvern, the 1st timber wolf, the 2nd green wyvern, and the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Aliyah the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Layana the Secian (flying beside you), Stanrar the Noble Human, Kristiona the Noble Leuian, Darrow the Secian, Osire the Noble Hithual, Aeslyn the Noble Drake, Kavita the Noble Secian, Roknar the Noble Human, Erich the Leuian, Smite the Oog-ra (holding a flaming glittering multicolored glass orb), Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Batch the Noble Hithual, Tau the Leuian (a black kitten upon his left shoulder), Dror the Noble Thugian, Syai the Noble Drake (flying 15 feet above you), and Tygrus the Leuian.
Obvious paths: east southeast south* southwest west.

[Open plains]

The treeline bends from north-south to east-west here, forming the northwest edge of the plains. The ground slopes more sharply upward as you near the foothills. The earth is more regular than most places on the plains. Still, you watch your step.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar), the 1st spotted fawn, and the 2nd spotted fawn.
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Aliyah the Secian (holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Layana the Secian (flying beside you), Stanrar the Noble Human, Kristiona the Noble Leuian, Darrow the Secian, Osire the Noble Hithual, Aeslyn the Noble Drake, Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Kavita the Noble Secian, Roknar the Noble Human, Erich the Leuian, Smite the Oog-ra, Noffbrau the Noble Hithual, Draffut the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Batch the Noble Hithual, Vermithrax the Drake (flying 20 feet above you), Tau the Leuian (a black kitten upon his left shoulder), Ying the Drake, Dror the Noble Thugian, Kiralyn the Secian (flying 20 feet above you), Syai the Noble Drake (flying 25 feet above you), and Tygrus the Leuian.

[Open plains]

Immense fir, redwood and sequoia trees block your path to the north up into the foothills. The ground here is full of rusty metal and small mounds, making the footing somewhat unstable.  The smell of an alpine forest drifts from the treeline.  A wooden tree branch, a glowing holy mark of Odarous, a worn leather money belt, a tattered weathered newspaper, a pair of ivy embossed leather gloves, some copper studded leather gauntlets, an ugly green troll mask, a gnarled weathered oak branch, a tiny shrunken skull pendant, an ancient jade eyed jackal sigil, and a pair of soft brown doeskin gloves are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st white tailed doe, the 1st timber wolf, the 2nd white tailed doe, the 1st spotted fawn, the 1st green wyvern, the 1st young green wyvern, the 2nd green wyvern, the 1st massive green wyvern, the 3rd green wyvern, the 3rd white tailed doe, and the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar).

l at z

Ziraxtan'a looks like a 51'11" standard 4th stage, winged massive boned, very muscular bodied black Dragon.
He is lying down.
He is bald, with golden eyes, and looks spotless.
He appears to be distant right now.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his head are enormous horns that shoot forward from in front of his fringed, spiked ear flaps. The razor-sharp tipped horns do not trail back towards the neck; rather they jut towards his diamond shaped face and curve along his jawline.

On his face are dual ridges of small hornlets that run up his face from each nostril, splitting to follow each eye ridge, and reconvening at the back of the skull. The hornlets grow in size as they ascend the face.

On his back are slender spines that run down his sinuous vertebrae. The upper half of the spines are joined by a webbed frill. The frill rises majestically from the mid of his muscled back and ends standing tall on the top the head.

On his wings are many scars that mar the bat-like, lilac-tinted skin that stretches over the alar limbs and covers the fingerlets.

He has no apparent injuries, but looks tired.

Physical appearance:

The hulking, obtuse majesty of the dragon before you commands attention. His black scales, each the size of a buckler, bulge with mass and muscle beneath. Each movement reveals a lavender tinge on the edges of his otherwise ebony scales.

The plains begin to slope upward toward the north here near the western edge of the plains.  Looking up to the north you can see the tops of snowcapped peaks beyond the foothills. [Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a freshly expanded hole, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a newly excavated opening, an ugly green troll mask, a wooden club, a short burnished silver mace, a large grey pearl figurine, a quiver of birch arrows, an ugly green troll mask, a worn leather money belt, a wooden club, and a sharpened dried bamboo stake are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st spotted fawn, the 1st timber wolf, the 1st white tailed doe, the 1st young green wyvern, the 1st massive green wyvern, the 1st leopard, and the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar).

[Open plains]

You are near the southern edge of the plains. Butterflies flit across the top of the lush grass here while bees are busy in the wildflowers. The plains teem with life. The breeze from the north brings the scent of the mountain forest to your nose. High above, a freshly painted tree house rests in the leafy canopy darkness of trees in the area. A small welcome sign and a mailbox with the name Faraway carved into it sit next to a grand maple tree.  A large maple tree, a closed mailbox, a closed dark mahogany door, a topaz encrusted silver spoon, a small ivory bead, a closed platinum trimmed teak traveling case, and a closed ribbon tied satin clerical bag are here.

This area is illuminated.

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a freshly expanded hole, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a newly excavated opening, an ugly green troll mask, a wooden club, a short burnished silver mace, a large grey pearl figurine, a quiver of birch arrows, an ugly green troll mask, a worn leather money belt, a wooden club, and a sharpened dried bamboo stake are here.

[Dragon cavern.]

Standing before you is a huge wall of thorny roots.  They have doubled back upon themselves so many times that it is impossible to see anything behind them. A strange, slightly familiar scent wafts through here. The encroaching flora makes this spot slightly claustrophobic.  A blackened Dragon runeward, a blackened vine-covered Dragon runeward, a blackened arcane glyph, a blackened semicircle of runewards, a tall mound of soil, an oddly shaped collection of rocks, a jagged mixed earthen conglomerate, a small hole, a cave opening, a widened opening, and an open supple bearskin sack are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st wolf (wearing a small gold collar) and the 1st spotted fawn.
In the area are Kalessin the Noble Drake, Hott the Noble Leuian, Forsythia the Drake (flying 5 feet below you), and Gwen the Secian.
Obvious paths: None.

>[Dragon cavern.]

Opening up before you is a huge, cavernous room. The walls are hewn from the earth and stone; huge, gnarled tree roots snake their way from top to bottom, looking as if they could reach out and grab you. The floor has been packed down so thoroughly that it nearly shines; it seems some very heavy footsteps have traveled across this floor.  A Cave opening and a tall mound of soil are here.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* northwest*.

[Dragon cavern.]

Here, in the center of the massive lair, is Norius'a's hoard. The number of gems here is astounding; they seem to glow in the dim torchlight. Massive tree roots have been trained into a complex, web-like network overhead. Tiny round pillows in many brilliant colors are placed in various spots all around the room, evidently for the comfort of visiting Secians.

This area is illuminated.
Obvious paths: north* east* south* west*.
n
>[Dragon cavern.]

Incense fills the air in this small room, so thick it is difficult to see. On the far wall, set into a niche, sits a single, massive gem unlike any you've ever seen before. It is faceted like a diamond, yet its surface gleams with a swirling, opalescent shimmer. It almost looks alive. Flanking the niche on either side are a pair of stone dragons.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Attkayet'a the Dragon, Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet below you), and Meliya the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand).
Obvious paths: southeast* south* southwest*.

[Dragon cavern.]

It is in this small, round room that Norius'a spends her most private moments. It is covered from wall to wall with the thickest, most luxurious fur you've ever seen or felt. While it is inviting, it seems a breach of her privacy to be standing here.  An indigo embroidered silk pillow is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area is Meliya the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand).

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a freshly expanded hole, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a newly excavated opening, a wooden club, a short burnished silver mace, a worn leather money belt, and a wooden club are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st timber wolf.
In the area are Domi the Secian (holding a spent flaming ruby tipped elm stave), Kalessin the Noble Drake, Romilin the Noble Psycian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Miriel the Secian, Vermithrax the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Marinda the Secian, Tchori the Leuian, and Munger the Noble Oog-ra (holding a glowing smoking berry leaf cigar).

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a freshly expanded hole, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a newly excavated opening, and a worn leather money belt are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st massive green wyvern and the 1st timber wolf.
In the area are Attkayet'a the Dragon (flying 10 feet above you), Morgahnn the Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet below you), Vermithrax the Drake (flying 15 feet above you), Meliya the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand), Forsythia the Drake, Tchori the Leuian (hovering 15 feet above you), Gwen the Secian, and Munger the Noble Oog-ra (holding a glowing smoking berry leaf cigar).
Obvious paths: north* northeast east* southeast south southwest west northwest.

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a freshly expanded hole, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of soil, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a newly excavated opening, and a worn leather money belt are here.

>[Forest path.]

>[Forest stream.]

The path ends here as it comes upon the steep banks of a forest stream.  A wooden bridge, in surprisingly good repair, crosses the stream. >[Riverbank.]

The river laps against this small dirt clearing. Foliage grows a healthy green next to the water. Smooth washed pebbles along with pieces of branches and leaves all clutter the dirt riverbank.  A small bird twitters in a singsong voice high in the trees. Just off to the west a little stone bridge spans the river.

>[Hope's Path.]

The path of four leaf clove shaped flagstones leads past a small clean shack and into a well formed tunnel through the thorn bushes to the east and the Caersech to the west. The small shack is set back from the road, its walls built of a whitewashed birch. A sturdy corral, filled with well-fed horses, stands to the left of the shack. A matched pair of dapple grays stand in front of the shack waiting to take their human baggage to their destination. To the left of the door, behind a small paned window, a beautiful Fir Elf female takes coin and in return, with a charming smile, directs those who have paid their fare into the waiting room.  A small shack, a freshly painted sign, a notice of non-refund, and a small winding stone pathway are here.

[Hope's Path.]

Contrasting starkly with the ashes of the forest and brush is a freshly constructed set of stairs that wraps itself about the large tree. The intricate woodwork that decorates the steps is of the finest quality, as if in parody to the blackened destruction of the hedges and brambles around the base of the trunk. Bright green leaves of clover have begun springing up through the ashy soil in conjunction with soft moss to lend a durable cushion to this well-traveled spot.  Some steps circling the tree, a freshly painted wooden sign, a healthy green patch of clover, a flowing marble fountain, and some clover shaped stones are here.

Strangers arriving at the top of the steps find themselves under the watchful eye of patrons seated at tables positioned about the light, airy room. A set of oak steps lead up to the new Council chambers. [Elindale's Temple.]

A large tapestry lines the outside wall of the passageway, most impressive in that it is not made of fabric, but of vines as tiny as thick hairs, growing in a weave. The delicate shadings of the plants is perfectly natural, and as the eye becomes unfocused, a picture of a diminutive, beautiful maiden sits amongst a foresty background. The wall opposite of this magnificent tapestry is lined with portraits of prominent temple leaders, the colors vibrant, bringing a life-like sense to the frames. The eyes of the maiden in the tapestry seem to follow you, staring directly as you pass, boring into your soul.  A vellum portrait, a canvas portrait, a suede portrait, some unfinished portraits, and a carefully painted silk screen are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: southwest* northwest*.

>[Elindale's Temple, Store.]

A few of Temple Elindale's more enterprising clerics have set up shop here. Shelves and niches of living wood display a broad selection of religious items for clerics as well as more mundane items that any follower of Elindale might find useful. Repeated attacks on both Treehaven and Temple Elindale have left the shopkeepers a bit skittish - with thin smiles, they politely turn away customers that don't bear the mark of Elindale.

This room is illuminated.

>[Elindale's Temple, Office Area.]

Fragrant flowers bloom in every corner of this area of the tree, the plants not in planters, mind you, but growing right into the flesh of the tree itself. The branch grew openly toward the top, allowing not only the sun and moon to cast rays down inside, but also permitting entrance to variant forms of wildlife. A ruby-throated hummingbird spends its time methodically tending to each bloom, the soft hum of its wings being almost musical. The base of the branch has grown upwards in what can only be described as inverted knots, a large one forming a table-like surface and another, smaller one, perfectly suited to resting one's bottom on.  A ledger and a closed polished rosewood temple cupboard are here.

[Open plains]

The trees give way to lush grasses and wildflowers to the north, northeast and east. The ground is irregular and in places, rather bumpy. The cause of the irregularity is unseen. [Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols. [Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch, some broken fir trees, a freshly expanded hole, a towering mound of freshly dug earth, a newly excavated opening, and a worn leather money belt are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st spotted fawn, the 1st raccoon, and the 2nd spotted fawn.
In the area are Domi the Secian, Lilioth the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Alyxandar the Leuian, Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Romilin the Noble Psycian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Attkayet'a the Dragon, Mirrdae the Drake's lifeless body, Morgahnn the Drake's lifeless body, Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Chip the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Pollii the Secian (holding a glowing pure white crystal long-stemmed rose), Vincel the Psycian (holding a glowing swirling multicolored globe), Ziraxtan'a the Great Dragon, Miriel the Secian (holding a flaming rose petal filled moonsilver censer), Aliyah the Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing hand-painted glass shadow box), Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Marinda the Secian, Forsythia the Drake, Tchori the Leuian, and Gwen the Secian.
Obvious paths: north northeast* east southeast* south southwest west northwest.

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch and some broken fir trees are here.

This area is illuminated.

Green just placed an empty clay jug of strong whiskey within his open leather healer's bag.

Ziraxtan'a looks like a 51'11" standard 4th stage, winged massive boned, very muscular bodied black Dragon.
He is lying down.
He is bald, with golden eyes, and looks spotless.
He appears to be distant right now.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his head are enormous horns that shoot forward from in front of his fringed, spiked ear flaps. The razor-sharp tipped horns do not trail back towards the neck; rather they jut towards his diamond shaped face and curve along his jawline.

On his face are dual ridges of small hornlets that run up his face from each nostril, splitting to follow each eye ridge, and reconvening at the back of the skull. The hornlets grow in size as they ascend the face.

On his back are slender spines that run down his sinuous vertebrae. The upper half of the spines are joined by a webbed frill. The frill rises majestically from the mid of his muscled back and ends standing tall on the top the head.

On his wings are many scars that mar the bat-like, lilac-tinted skin that stretches over the alar limbs and covers the fingerlets.

He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

The hulking, obtuse majesty of the dragon before you commands attention. His black scales, each the size of a buckler, bulge with mass and muscle beneath. Each movement reveals a lavender tinge on the edges of his otherwise ebony scales.

[Forest Path.]

[Pollii and Chip's Tree House.]

This large square room is made of wood and blends in naturally to the tree that is supporting it some 50 feet above the plains below. A big harvest table sits in the middle of the room surrounded by many chairs, some very  large, some very small and elevated on boxes. In the corner of the room, under a picture window, are several benches and pillows. On one wall sits a pot bellied stove, the fire crackling within it keeps a kettle perpetually at the boil and fills the room with warmth. Next to the stove stands a larder with some drying moss hanging from a nail above it. In the far corner of the room, a branch of the tree protrudes through the floor and continues through an enlarged hole in the ceiling.  A small chair, a large chair, a bench, a pillow, a closed large wrought iron stove, an open dark mahogany door, a closed larder, an open small pink door, and a glass window are here.

This room is illuminated.
You see the 1st timber wolf.
In the room are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian, Domi the Secian, Lilioth the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Pluck the Secian (flying 5 feet above you and holding a glowing massive platinum cigar-smoking drake), Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Mirrdae the Drake, Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Chip the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Pollii the Secian (holding a glowing pure white crystal long-stemmed rose), Miriel the Secian (holding a flaming rose petal filled moonsilver censer), Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, Sebbien the Drake, and Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet above you).

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch and some broken fir trees are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st massive green wyvern.

[Open plains]

The few lone fir trees that once stood mighty in this open plain have been broken in half and thrown casually to the side. The earth has been ripped up, exposing the dark black soil underneath. Several piles of grass, moss, rocks, and soil are piled in various directions, remnants of the freshly excavated ground. The giant hole leading into the ground reveals a dense curtain of thorny roots, surrounded by a multitude of strange symbols.  A light branch and some broken fir trees are here.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st massive green wyvern and the 1st black kitten (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian, Domi the Secian, Lilioth the Secian, Pluck the Secian (flying 15 feet above you and holding a glowing massive platinum cigar-smoking drake), Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Chip the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Pollii the Secian, Miriel the Secian (holding a flaming rose petal filled moonsilver censer), Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, Sebbien the Drake, Meliya the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand), and Gwen the Secian (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest* west northwest.

[Open plains]

You are near the southern edge of the plains. Butterflies flit across the top of the lush grass here while bees are busy in the wildflowers. The plains teem with life. The breeze from the north brings the scent of the mountain forest to your nose. High above, a freshly painted tree house rests in the leafy canopy darkness of trees in the area. A small welcome sign and a mailbox with the name Faraway carved into it sit next to a grand maple tree.  A large maple tree, a closed mailbox, a closed dark mahogany door, a small black coral figurine, and a closed raccoonskin pack are here.

The path branches again, finally leading away from the hill. Your feet and legs are getting damp as the wet ferns brush against your legs. The trees open up slightly here and you think it would be a nice place to rest, if it weren't for the hill.  Some lush ferns are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian, Domi the Secian, Lilioth the Secian, Pluck the Secian (flying 15 feet above you and holding a glowing massive platinum cigar-smoking drake), Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Chip the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Pollii the Secian, Miriel the Secian (holding a flaming rose petal filled moonsilver censer), Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, Sebbien the Drake, Meliya the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand), and Gwen the Secian (flying beside you).

[Forest path.]

The path slopes down to the south here as it leads away from the hill.  The evergreens subside as the ground becomes moist due to the proximity of the stream. The undergrowth is quite thick here, and the music of the stream begins to pervade your senses.  A charming embankment is here.

[Forest stream.]

The path ends here as it comes upon the steep banks of a forest stream.  A wooden bridge, in surprisingly good repair, crosses the stream. The skeletal remains of some fish litter the stream bank and nosing about you notice some large pawprints.  A wooden bridge and some skeletal fish remains are here.

The area brightens.
[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and a small winding stone path are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian, Domi the Secian, Lilioth the Secian, Pluck the Secian (flying 15 feet above you and holding a glowing massive platinum cigar-smoking drake), Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Chip the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Pollii the Secian, Miriel the Secian (holding a flaming rose petal filled moonsilver censer), Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, Sebbien the Drake, Meliya the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand), and Gwen the Secian (flying beside you).

[Ravine.]

A narrow strip of mud separates the cliff face from the churning waters at the bottom of the falls. A misty spray soaks this path that terminates at a deep blue pool to the south. Continuing north, the path disappears into a muddy bog.  A rotting hemp rope and a muddy path to the bog are here.

l
The area brightens.
[Waterfall.]

The narrow muddy path ends at the edge of a deep blue pool. Overhead, the waters of the forest stream gush out into the frothing river. A gentler cascade trickles down the rock face of the chasm, creating a double waterfall. The hardened mud to one side of the path holds the impressions and footsteps of a struggle that occurred here, and a few scattered scales that were dislodged during the battle are becoming petrified into the surroundings by the deposits from the mist of the double waterfall. A rock shelf rests a few feet above the pool, housing an inviting combination of moss and clover.  A beautiful flowing waterfall, a deep blue pool, and a soft mossy patch of clover are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian, Domi the Secian, Lilioth the Secian, Pluck the Secian (flying 15 feet above you and holding a glowing massive platinum cigar-smoking drake), Equality the Noble Secian (holding a flaming refreshing orange scented candle), Morgahnn the Drake (flying 5 feet above you), Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian, Chip the Secian (holding a glowing gold-flecked crystalla shard), Pollii the Secian, Miriel the Secian (holding a flaming rose petal filled moonsilver censer), Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, Sebbien the Drake, Meliya the Noble Secian (holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand), and Gwen the Secian (flying beside you).
Obvious paths: north*.

[Waterfall.]

The narrow muddy path ends at the edge of a deep blue pool. Overhead, the waters of the forest stream gush out into the frothing river. A gentler cascade trickles down the rock face of the chasm, creating a double waterfall. The hardened mud to one side of the path holds the impressions and footsteps of a struggle that occurred here, and a few scattered scales that were dislodged during the battle are becoming petrified into the surroundings by the deposits from the mist of the double waterfall. A rock shelf rests a few feet above the pool, housing an inviting combination of moss and clover.  A beautiful flowing waterfall, a deep blue pool, and a soft mossy patch of clover are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Linneastrylon the Noble Secian, Domi the Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Lilioth the Secian, Pluck the Secian (flying 20 feet above ground and holding a glowing massive platinum cigar-smoking drake), Equality the Noble Secian, Morgahnn the Drake, Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Chip the Secian, Pollii the Secian, Miriel the Secian, Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, Sebbien the Drake (flying 20 feet above ground), Meliya the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above ground and holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand), and Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground).
Obvious paths: north.
>

[Waterfall.]

The narrow muddy path ends at the edge of a deep blue pool. Overhead, the waters of the forest stream gush out into the frothing river. A gentler cascade trickles down the rock face of the chasm, creating a double waterfall. The hardened mud to one side of the path holds the impressions and footsteps of a struggle that occurred here, and a few scattered scales that were dislodged during the battle are becoming petrified into the surroundings by the deposits from the mist of the double waterfall. A rock shelf rests a few feet above the pool, housing an inviting combination of moss and clover.  A beautiful flowing waterfall, a deep blue pool, a soft mossy patch of clover, and some silver coins are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Domi the Secian, Kalessin the Noble Drake, Caylith the Drake, Pluck the Secian (flying 20 feet above ground and holding a glowing massive platinum cigar-smoking drake), Equality the Noble Secian, Attkayet'a the Dragon, Mirrdae the Drake, Morgahnn the Drake, Aelestithiel the Noble Drake, Ceresina the Noble Secian (flying 10 feet above ground), Chip the Secian, Pollii the Secian, Ziraxtan'a the Great Dragon (flying 10 feet above ground), Miriel the Secian, Viator the Draco, Losmir the Draco, Relawen the Drake, Forsythia the Drake, Sebbien the Drake (flying 20 feet above ground), Ying the Drake, Meliya the Noble Secian (flying 5 feet above ground and holding a glowing swirling tornado of desert sand), and Gwen the Secian (flying 5 feet above ground).

l at z

Ziraxtan'a looks like a 51'11" standard 4th stage, winged massive boned, very muscular bodied black Dragon.
He is lying down.
He is bald, with golden eyes, and looks spotless.
He appears to be distant right now.
He can be attacked by other players.

On his head are enormous horns that shoot forward from in front of his fringed, spiked ear flaps. The razor-sharp tipped horns do not trail back towards the neck; rather they jut towards his diamond shaped face and curve along his jawline.

On his face are dual ridges of small hornlets that run up his face from each nostril, splitting to follow each eye ridge, and reconvening at the back of the skull. The hornlets grow in size as they ascend the face.

On his back are slender spines that run down his sinuous vertebrae. The upper half of the spines are joined by a webbed frill. The frill rises majestically from the mid of his muscled back and ends standing tall on the top the head.

On his wings are many scars that mar the bat-like, lilac-tinted skin that stretches over the alar limbs and covers the fingerlets.

He appears to be in perfect health.

Physical appearance:

The hulking, obtuse majesty of the dragon before you commands attention. His black scales, each the size of a buckler, bulge with mass and muscle beneath. Each movement reveals a lavender tinge on the edges of his otherwise ebony scales.

>[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and a small winding stone path are here.

[Hope's Path.]

A small stream runs noisily under the two bridges spanning the ravine. A number of the brunt oaks still stand about, memorials to the forest this once was. A number of small saplings dot the ground between the black trunks. Between the stream bank and oaks, a small path of four-leaf-clover shaped stones weave a windy path through the forest.  A stone bridge, a wooden bridge, a clump of wildgrass, and a small winding stone path are here.

This area is illuminated.

>[Riverside.]

Swollen beyond its banks, the once small creek is now a rushing overflowing river. What used to be the charred footbridge is now a safe haven for fish well down river, nothing left of its structure. Set well into the bank of the river is a long steel pole. Lashed to the pole is a heavy rope. The voice of the riverboat captain can be heard echoing across the water, taking command and moving his cargo.  A flowing river, a freshly painted sign, some carved oak benches, a snow angel, a pile of snow, a spent ruby tipped elm stave, and a riverboat are here.

>[Riverboat.]

A thick mist circles about the river and the boat as it very slowly is pulled across the river.  A wooden railing and an exit are here.

sw
Ravens dark as pitch spread their feathers to a wing-span of nearly four feet, so large they are, as they quarrel over an abandoned mule carcass on the roadside breaks out. How final death seems, so casually nature simply encompasses the bodies of the fallen, through carrion hunters or moldy decay. Yet through death there be life again, any number of these ravens being sustained through this death, so they may live. Perhaps only to become sustenance for one of the swamp creatures, who, in turn, spends its life continuing the cycle.

[East Trade Road.]

The open plains are becoming scattered with scraggly trees, the wood of which proving inefficient to use for building as the elements of nature have grown the trunks so twisted and hard in order to withstand the onslaughts of time. Circling around the northern base of a small hill, there lies the lapping edge of the swamp to the south. Small slimy creatures lie on the smooth stones near the water, darting into it at the speed of light as you near them with tiny splashes and echoing wakes blending into the small, gentle waves coming into the shore. Swarms of mosquitoes move along the land in unison, lending them the appearance of large, unified bodies hovering around for the next feast.

[Wilderness gate.]

Set within a wide tunnel leading through the hedge to the north is the Wilderness Gate. It separates the settled lands of Spur from the open plains to the south of the city. The plains stretch as far as the eyes can see, the horizon and the walls of the fort down the road the only blemishes of the grassy landscape in the distance. The stones of the road are smoothly set together, well built to withstand heavy travel. [Southern Tradeway.]

The tradeway runs across the open grasslands northeast towards the Spur, and southwest towards distant lands and eventually, the coast. The plains to the south and east seem totally indifferent to your existence. Just ahead, a small path moves up a village of huts spread out in a semi-circle. In the center of the village a giant fire pit sits where barbarians who wander through the village can sit around to stay warm.  A worn grassy path is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Caylith the Drake, Mirrdae the Drake, and Viator the Draco.
Obvious paths: north northeast* east southeast south southwest west northwest.
[Southern Tradeway.]

The tradeway runs across the open grasslands northeast towards the Spur, and southwest towards distant lands and eventually, the coast. The plains to the south and east seem totally indifferent to your existence. Just ahead, a small path moves up a village of huts spread out in a semi-circle. In the center of the village a giant fire pit sits where barbarians who wander through the village can sit around to stay warm.  A worn grassy path is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Caylith the Drake, Mirrdae the Drake, and Viator the Draco.
Obvious paths: north northeast east southeast south southwest west northwest.
>
You follow Caylith southwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Southern Tradeway.]

The stone paved tradeway stretches across the open plains, interrupting nature's task of consuming the land. An endless sea of grass surrounds you, lapping at the road much like the tides against a beach. The faintly damp wind occasionally blowing in from the west smells of earth. Some of the stones in the road interlock together to form the crude image of a lion. There is no discerning if it was done on purpose or sheer accident.

This area is illuminated.
You see the 1st black cat (wearing a small gold collar).
In the area are Caylith the Drake, Mirrdae the Drake, and Viator the Draco.

[Southern Tradeway.]

Only the well-built, stone tradeway gives any hint of civilization ever having had any presence here. The tall grasses limit visibility nearby, hiding any wildlife that may be waiting for prey to stumble too close. A few blades of grass sway slightly in the breeze, some of them broken by the passing of something heavy over them. One of the larger stones in the road, broken loose from its mortar, waits patiently to be repaired.

[Southern Tradeway.]

The grass rises taller and taller in every direction further limiting view just off the roadside. A second glance reveals that this is the lowest point in a large, shallow depression. The tradeway sinks a little lower as it gets closer to the river off to the west. A ditch runs alongside the river's side of the road, small puddles of water filling the bottom. Trickles filter into the puddles from the grass beyond as mosquitoes dart across the muddy surfaces.

[Southern Tradeway.]

Rising up out of the plains, a large walled fort receives the end of the stone road. The river flows from either side, running through the fort from this angle of view. The vegetation surrounding the tradeway at this point has been burned out recently, allowing a clear field of vision from the tops of the walls ahead. The stones show little wear from the heavy traffic of feet and wheels alike; it has certainly been well constructed.

[Meetpoint gate.]

Standing before you lies the dilapidated remains of a once proud fort. Erected up for many feet one can see the silhouette of a stocky figure far above in what appears to resemble a Guard's Post. Attentive and composed many guards protect this outer wall with their blades and bows.

[Meetpoint gate.]

Standing before you lies the dilapidated remains of a once proud fort. Erected up for many feet one can see the silhouette of a stocky figure far above in what appears to resemble a Guard's Post. Attentive and composed many guards protect this outer wall with their blades and bows.

[Meetpoint.]

Two guards patrol above the gate, looking you over carefully before giving leave to pass through the heavy wood gate. Thick and long wooden ladders serve up to the guard's posts high in the sky so that they may have some relief from their duties overlooking the land and city. Through the slates of the wooden walkways, you can make out four archers playing a game of cards, weapons at the ready. A whip cracks loudly as a caravan heads out the gate towards Spur.  A glowing wrought iron lantern is here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Caylith the Drake, Mirrdae the Drake, and Viator the Draco.
Obvious paths: southeast southwest* northwest.

You follow Caylith southwest...

[Meetpoint Square.]

Within the heart of this proud fort one can see all around that the reconstruction of its buildings has begun. Large stones and logs have been stacked and piled, while some workers tirelessly attempt to repair the damage that occurred here during the Lords of Chaos wars. The buildings and homes of the people that resided here are slowly taking shape, though, far from completed. The smell of dyes, used to paint the town, permeate the area.  A breathtaking shimmering bouquet of moonflowers, an open light blue door, and a glowing wrought iron street lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Caylith the Drake, Mirrdae the Drake, and Viator the Draco.
Obvious paths: north* northeast* east* southeast southwest* west* northwest*.

You follow Caylith southwest...

[Meetpoint.]

Here a gate leads out of the fort and into the Southern regions. Several children run and play just inside the gate, under the watchful eyes of the guards. What was once a very well used trade route has slowed to some caravans bringing supplies for the townsmen and the occasional merchants traveling from the far southern reaches of the land. Many guards protect this section of the fort as it is home to some wild beasts that live outside these walls. In the distance, you can make out two more guards hunting the frogmen that often try to attack the city and caravans.  An open large sturdy wooden gate and a glowing wrought iron lantern are here.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Caylith the Drake, Mirrdae the Drake, and Viator the Draco.
Obvious paths: northeast* southeast northwest.

You follow Caylith through an open large sturdy wooden gate...


l

[Meetpoint gate.]

A few guards do a roving patrol of the area and down to the bridge. They check the caravans before they enter and anyone that looks suspicious they throw into the river. They seem quite wary of anyone coming or going to and from the city. From their appearance it would seem best to stay on their good sides and hope that they are in good moods.  An open large sturdy wooden gate and a stone bridge are here.

[Bridge]

With Meetpoint at your heels this rugged old cobblestone bridge leads to the Southern Plains and the main trade routes from spur and Meetpoint to the Southernmost reaches of the lands. Signs that this road was once well traveled by the hustle and bustle of laden carts are plain to view. Though, with the hardened clay-like mud and the fact that it has not rained here in some time it is obvious that these tracks are very old.

In the area are Caylith the Drake and Mirrdae the Drake.
Obvious paths: southwest northwest.
>
You follow Caylith northwest...


l
The area brightens.
[Forest path.]

The forest path follows a muddy gully eroded by a shallow stream. Tall pine and oak trees tower above both sides of the muddy banks. Large mossy stones force the stream to twist and turn as it flows slowly south. The ground seems to be sloping downward slightly as the stream cuts back to the southeast.

This area is illuminated.
In the area are Caylith the Drake and Mirrdae the Drake.
Obvious paths: northeast southeast*.

[Forest path.]

The path seems to be disappearing before your very eyes. Travel any way but back to the northwest is blocked by foliage so dense as to prevent any further passage into the forest. An ancient oak tree festooned with bright colorful silk ribbons stands to the side of the disappearing path. Sparkling trinkets and gems hang from every available branch, a  cheerful tinkling noise filling the air with the slightest breeze.  A giant ancient oak tree, a fragrant bluish Secian rose, a tiny oak knothole, some swirling multicolored paper hanging lanterns, some flowing colorful paper streamers, an elegant crystal platter of treats, an elegant silver platter, and a huge soft cotton picnic blanket are here.

This area is illuminated.

go kno
>[Secian's Tree.]

Colorful woven silk rugs cover the sparkling polished oak floor of this large cavernous room in the center of the ancient tree. Large soft silk-covered feather pillows lay scattered about the floor, and a shimmering crystal fountain sits in the center of the chamber. A beautiful mural has been painted on one wall and adds even more color to the room.  A blue and white silken rope leading up, a tiny oak knothole, a soft blue and white velvet sofa, a soft green silk pillow, a soft red silk pillow, a soft yellow silk pillow, and a soft blue silk pillow are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: None.
go ro
>[Secian's Tree, Sleeping Area.]

A gentle feeling of peace and serenity drifts through this cozy room, and the light-hearted sound of birds singing in the forest around the great tree adds a wondrous music that could never be imitated.  Soft feather-filled pallets just the right sizes for Secians to sleep on rest in different spots around the room.  A blue and white silken rope leading down, a small opening in the branches, a soft pallet, a soft pallet, a soft pallet, a soft pallet, and some shimmering mirrors are here.

This room is illuminated.
Obvious exits: east*.
